title: Job Openings at Erisco Foods Limited
content:
Erisco Foods Limited is a leading manufacturer of Tomato paste and other made in Nigeria drinks and food products and the 4th largest tomato paste producing company in the world.

We are recruiting to fill the following positions below: 

1.) Health & Safety Officer

Job Location: Ikeja, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Description
     

            
    




	We are seeking a dedicated and experienced Health & Safety Officer to join our team.
	The successful candidate will be responsible for ensuring a safe and compliant work environment by conducting risk assessments, developing and implementing safety policies, training employees on safety protocols, investigating incidents, monitoring compliance, and maintaining accurate safety records. This role plays a key part in fostering a strong safety culture across the organization.


Responsibilities


	Conduct regular risk assessments and safety audits across the organization.
	Develop, implement, and review workplace health and safety policies.
	Provide safety training and awareness programs for employees.
	Investigate accidents, incidents, and near misses, and recommend corrective measures.
	Monitor compliance with regulatory requirements and company standards.
	Maintain accurate records and reports related to health and safety activities.
	Promote a proactive safety culture throughout the workplace.


Requirements


	Bachelor’s Degree in Occupational Health and Safety, Environmental Health & Safety, Environmental Health, Safety Management, Public Health, Industrial Hygiene, Environmental Science, or Engineering.
	Minimum of 3 years of relevant experience in a health and safety role.
	Professional certifications such as Certified Safety Professional (CSP), Certified Occupational Health Specialist (COHS), OSHA, or NEBOSH are required.
	Strong knowledge of health, safety, and environmental regulations and best practices.
	Excellent communication and training skills with the ability to influence and engage employees at all levels.
	Strong analytical and problem-solving abilities.


Benefits


	Competitive salary and benefits package.
	Opportunities for professional growth and development.
	A supportive work environment that values employee well-being and safety.


Application Closing Date: 17th September, 2025.

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV and cover letter to: recruitment@eriscofoodsltd.com.ng using “Health & Safety Officer – Erisco Foods” as the subject of the email.

 

 

2.) Auditor

Job Location: Ikeja, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary


	We are seeking a detail-oriented and proactive Auditor to join our team.
	The successful candidate will be responsible for examining financial records, ensuring compliance with internal policies and statutory regulations, and recommending improvements to enhance efficiency and safeguard company assets.


Key Responsibilities


	Plan and conduct internal audits across departments to ensure compliance with company policies and regulatory standards.
	Review financial statements, expense reports, and accounting records for accuracy.
	Evaluate internal control systems, identify weaknesses, and recommend corrective actions.
	Monitor compliance with tax regulations and statutory requirements.
	Prepare audit reports highlighting findings, risks, and recommendations.
	Follow up on the implementation of audit recommendations.
	Assist management in risk management, fraud detection, and operational efficiency improvement.


Requirements


	B.Sc. or HND in Accounting, Finance, Economics, or related field.
	Minimum of 3 - 5 years of proven experience as an Auditor, preferably in a manufacturing/FMCG environment.
	Professional certification (ICAN, ACCA, or equivalent) is an added advantage.
	Strong knowledge of auditing standards, financial regulations, and internal control frameworks.
	Excellent analytical, organizational, and communication skills.
	High level of integrity, objectivity, and attention to detail.


Application Closing Date: 15th September, 2025.

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: recruitment@eriscofoodsltd.com.ng using “Auditor” as the subject of the email.

 

 

3.) Human Resource Officer

Job Location: Ikeja, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary


	We are seeking a proactive and detail-oriented Human Resource Officer to join our team.
	The ideal candidate will support the HR department in implementing policies, managing recruitment, employee relations, performance management, and ensuring compliance with company standards.


Key Responsibilities


	Maintain accurate employee records and HR documentation.
	Support employee onboarding, training, and development programs.
	Handle employee relations and promptly address staff concerns.
	Ensure compliance with labor laws and company policies.
	Assist with performance management processes.
	Provide HR reports to management as required.
	Manage full-cycle recruitment: sourcing, screening, interviewing, and onboarding.
	Develop and update job descriptions and job ads across platforms.


Requirements


	B.Sc. / HND in Human Resource Management, Business Administration, or related field.
	Minimum of 2 - 3 years of relevant HR experience (FMCG/Manufacturing industry experience is an advantage).
	Strong knowledge of labor laws and HR best practices.
	Excellent communication, interpersonal, and organizational skills.
	Proficiency in MS Office Suite.
	Ability to work under pressure and maintain confidentiality.


Application Closing Date: 9th September, 2025.

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: recruitment@eriscofoodsltd.com.ng using the Job Position as the subject of the email.

Costarchem Nigeria is a world leader in the delivery of tailored constructive solutions for virtually any type of construction project, combining high-quality products, expert technical support, customer service and innovation. Costar Building Product system has been producing innovative construction chemicals that help gives strength and increase the life span of a modern building.

We are recruiting to fill the following positions below:

1.) Admin / Facility Officer

Job Location: Ikeja, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary
     

            
    




	The Admin/Facility Officer will be responsible for overseeing the day-to-day administrative and facility management operations of the organization.
	This includes ensuring proper maintenance of office facilities, utilities, and equipment, as well as providing basic IT and electrical support.
	The role requires a proactive individual with strong organizational skills, technical knowledge, and the ability to resolve facility and IT-related issues efficiently.


Key Responsibilities
Administrative & Facility Management:


	Oversee general office administration, including office supplies, utilities, and workspace management.
	Supervise the maintenance and repair of office facilities, equipment, and infrastructure.
	Manage vendor relationships and service providers (cleaning, security, maintenance, etc.).
	Maintain records of facility operations, maintenance schedules, and service contracts.
	Ensure compliance with health, safety, and environmental regulations within the premises.
	Coordinate logistics for office activities, meetings, and staff welfare needs.


IT Support:


	Provide first-level IT support for staff (hardware/software troubleshooting, system setups, printers, scanners, and network connectivity).
	Assist in the installation and configuration of computer systems, applications, and network devices.
	Coordinate with external IT vendors for advanced technical issues or system upgrades.
	Support data backup and basic cybersecurity practices across office systems.


Electrical & Technical Support:


	Carry out minor electrical repairs, installations, and maintenance of office lighting, sockets, and power systems.
	Monitor and ensure efficient use of electrical equipment, including generators, inverters, and UPS systems.
	Liaise with technical contractors for major electrical works or facility upgrades.
	Conduct routine checks to minimize downtime and ensure business continuity.


Qualifications & Requirements


	Bachelor’s degreein Business Administration, Facility Management, Electrical Engineering, Information Technology, or a related field.
	4–6 years of proven experience in administration, facility management, or a related role.
	Basic IT support skills (hardware/software troubleshooting, networking, MS Office).
	Hands-on knowledge of electrical systems, installations, and repairs.
	Strong organizational and multitasking skills.
	Good communication and vendor management abilities.
	Ability to work independently and respond quickly to operational challenges.


Key Competencies:


	Problem-solving and technical aptitude.
	Attention to detail and proactive approach.
	Strong interpersonal and communication skills.
	Ability to prioritize tasks under pressure.
	Commitment to safety, compliance, and operational efficiency.


Application Closing Date: 30th September, 2025.

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: hr@costarchem.com using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.

 

2.) Production Manager

Job Location: Sagamu, Ogun
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Description


	The Production Manager is responsible for overseeing and managing all aspects of chemical production activities, ensuring efficiency, quality, safety, and compliance with industry regulations.
	This role requires strong leadership and a deep understanding of chemical manufacturing processes to drive productivity while maintaining the highest standards of health, safety, and environmental practices.


Key Responsibilities


	Plan, coordinate, and control all manufacturing operations to meet production targets in line with company objectives.
	Oversee the formulation, blending, batching, and packaging processes to ensure accuracy, consistency, and quality.
	Ensure strict adherence to safety, health, and environmental regulations (e.g., NAFDAC, SON, ISO standards).
	Supervise, train, and develop the production team, including supervisors, technicians, and operators.
	Monitor production performance, analyze KPIs, and implement corrective actions where necessary.
	Coordinate with Quality Control, Maintenance, Supply Chain, and other departments for seamless operations.
	Develop and manage production budgets, minimize waste, and optimize resource utilization.
	Ensure proper maintenance of plant machinery and equipment in coordination with the engineering team.
	Lead continuous improvement initiatives (e.g., lean manufacturing, 5S, Kaizen) to improve efficiency and product quality.
	Prepare regular production reports and present updates to senior management.


Qualifications and Experience


	B.Sc./HND in Chemical Engineering, Industrial Chemistry, or related discipline.
	Minimum of 9–12years of experience in chemical or related manufacturing industries, with at least 6years in a managerial role.
	Proven experience in managing production teams and processes in a regulated environment.


Skills and Competencies:


	Strong leadership and team management skills.
	In-depth knowledge of chemical production processes and quality systems.
	Sound understanding of HSE standards and compliance requirements.
	Proficiency in production planning tools and ERP systems.
	Excellent analytical, organizational, and decision-making skills.
	Strong communication and interpersonal abilities.
	Ability to manage multiple priorities and work under pressure.


Application Closing Date: 30th September, 2025.

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: hr@costarchem.com using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.

 

3.) Sales Administrator

Job Location: Abuja (FCT)
Employment Type: Full-time

Responsibilites


	Process calls, mails and online sales request from clients promptly
	Analyze existing and potential markets to identify and secure business development opportunities
	Receive and respond to customer inquiries, queries, attend to walk-in customers and escalate matters to appropriate departments (accounts, warehouse etc)
	Design and deliver technical training and continuous development initiatives.
	Closely work with sales and marketing counterparts to ensure product launch, exhibitions, and events are well supported.
	Provide back-end support to the sales team in the discharge of functions
	Maintain an accurate database of client and prospect information
	Ensure accuracy of all time bound submissions to external clients (quotations, invoices, orders)
	Demonstrate expert knowledge on company products for effective service delivery
	Manage end to end delivery of processed orders promptly
	Compile sales reports and monitor sales efforts
	Communicate customer feedback
	Coordinate technical forums and presentations within the country.
	Develop good customer relationship by phone calls, follow-ups, emails, broadcasts etc.
	Provide technical expertise, offered technology, tools, on customer’s technical –related business needs.


Qualifications


	Interested candidates should possess a Bachelor's Degree with 4-6 experience.


Application Closing Date: 20th September, 2025.

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: hr@costarchem.com using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.
